author: andrewgoodwall
title: Future of Cardano is in East Asia
description: Youth across various East Asian countries are unaware of Cardano and the entrepreneurship opportunities that exist.

f6_assessments.q0: The central idea of ​​the proposal is to promote knowledge about Cardano and about blockchain in general for young people in East Asia. It is possible to present as one of the differentials of the project the platform that will be used, GoodWall. We realize that it is an already established medium to transmit knowledge, having millions of users and reaching several countries. As a result, several barriers are instantly broken, as a possible need to develop refined dissemination strategies. With the growth of popularity among young people in this region in relation to Cardano, it is possible to perceive several benefits to our ecosystem, such as a greater emergence of ideas to solve local problems that can result in possible proposals. Therefore, the impact of this project is positive in the long term. And as the app has a good part of its audience being in Asia, we can also see a real scalability of the materials produced by this project. Regarding the concepts that were structured and also considering the professionals involved, we see that the budget being requested of $22,500 seems consistent.
f6_assessments.q1:
Perhaps the biggest difference in relation to this project, and what makes us believe in its viability, is the infrastructure behind the educational mission described here. We noticed several nuances in the team plan that go beyond the singular purpose of producing educational materials. Several other organizations and concerns are cited for this content to be taken full advantage of by its users. In this context, we can see a great focus on the design of the project, as well as the support that will be given by the team during the process, with the answers to questions and collecting feedback from users. Furthermore, the periods for carrying out the main tasks (preparation, execution and results) are well defined. Another positive factor is the constant involvement of the team with Cardano to understand which concepts to use in the production of materials. In short, we can see that the project is not just creating material, but a path of knowledge, which even motivates its participants to be active, which seems to increase the feasibility of the proposal.

Regarding the professionals involved in the project, we see that the team has impressive characteristics for carrying out the work. There are several attributes they have, such as planning, project management, marketing and creation of educational content. We also see that the professionals involved are generally very experienced. For example, Michaela Usakova has more than 12 years of experience in product and brand design and other attributes. Additionally, we see that the professionals involved have made their resumes available and also a section on the GoodWall website where you can learn more about them (https://www.goodwall.io/about).

Regarding the details of the budget, we see a consistent distribution of capital between different areas for the development of the project. It is interesting to see that the team was even concerned with reserving part of the budget for awards, encouraging even more public engagement.
f6_assessments.q2:
Good ways of tracking progress were established, as well as ways of measuring the effectiveness of these ways. We can say this from the parameters exposed as indicative of development: impressions, engagement and submission of challenge materials. These three factors demonstrate well whether:

People watched the video (which is on average well matched by impressions)

Engagement was generated from that (people liked what they watched and reacted to it)

Engagement was effective to the point where people produced materials on the topic (this is accompanied by the submission of materials)

And in terms of success, we noted that numbers were given to make these earlier concepts quantifiable. We noticed this from the expected numbers of engagement (30,000), impressions (1,000,000) and challenges delivered (2,000).

f6_assessments.q0:
As a platform with a huge customer base, I believe Goodwall has the ability to create a considerable impact. 
Implementation of the proposal helps in onboarding a large community to Cardano and Catalyst along with educating youth on Blockchain tech as a whole.
This is a great proposal for creating the next generation of Cardano developers and community leaders.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is very experienced and I have no doubt that they are capable of implementing the proposal in terms of community outreach.
The reason I gave a rating of 4 instead of 5 is that there is no one mentioned in the team that has specific experience related to blockchain tech or blockchain education.
It’d be really helpful to add the team member who is responsible for creating the specific educational content mentioned in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audibility of the proposal is clear and specific in terms of impact created. 
The end report shared in the proposal is very detailed and paints a clear picture of the process involved.
To add to that, the number of impressions, engagements and challenge entries goes a long way in terms of auditing the proposal’s impact.

f6_assessments.q0:
Looking at the apps & the channel of Goidwall which has over 2+ members,  the aim of educating the youth in East Asia between the ages of 16 -24yrs on the ABC or basics on blockchain, it's application  & social impact possibilities are highly recommendable.
I believe,  such education to the East Asia youth,  will go a long way to identify talent/skills, abilities/capabilities to be tapped & sharpened for equality & inclusive opportunities for all. 
This,  will drastically enhance the maximisation of potential which will largely impact positively on East Asia society
f6_assessments.q1:
Implementation is highly likely to be successful with its programming with stipulated time to be achieved. 
Firstly, is the Preparation Prog., where resources are gathered n put together towards its execution & its duration is from 8-12 solid weeks. 
Next, the Execution Prog. & its the action or demonstration stage n for 16weeks.
Lastly,  the Prog. Result for 3-4weeks and this is where,  Participants are engaged through survey, Result Analysis etc.
More detailed programming with breakdown expenses are stated here.
Support Team for successful implementation are of high learnered, experienced with least experience of not less than 3yrs. 

Next
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes,information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and a few to look at are the ff:
Aim to receive at least 2000 video entrants demonstrating cardano tech use from East Asia & multilingual teams across the continent, 
Internal KPI to know how many times branded content has been displayed,  the number of times branded content has been liked & number of times the program videos/pictures have been unloaded etc.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal satisfies any given challenge. In addition, the completeness and detail of each question they answer shows how serious and confident they are about the project they are going to run, regardless of the existence of this Goodwall app. First, we see that this goodwall is aimed at young people, especially Gen Z and also young entrepreneurs about what blockchain is and how it works. The initial steps they took were extraordinary, such as conducting a Dialogue with Goodwall's Student Council, regular communication, counseling, focus groups and post program surveys to make this application more relevant and increase scalability to be even better in terms of infrastructure and UI. /UX. With their long term vision expressed for the next 6-12 months on how to target the market, whatever they are doing is a good step to get serious about expanding the blockchain community and education about blockchain. What I admire about this proposal is the information about micro tasking for youth who participate in this program which gives us an idea of ​​what they are doing and what they will achieve. Addition of key objectives to be more convincing and provide a brief but concise and clear description of this proposal. Then at the end, the challenges and risks they may face have been explained in a very complete and detailed manner and moreover, what points will they face and how to solve each challenge or risk they can briefly provide. In the end, The problem statement can't be more specific and The solution statement is sufficient to meet/relate well about the problem statement that they crafted perfectly.
f6_assessments.q1: The project team proves to be very well prepared to carry it out, because they provide a small individual description of who they are, which is summed up by their contacts on social networks, making real the possibility of making direct contact and getting to know them better. About the script, they present which phases would need to be completed to reach their goals, but I believe that these phases could be explored further. For example, "Promotional assets design", what kind of marketing strategy what you would use ? (If social media, what kind of social media, and how do you exploit it to make it more attention?). t is always good to explain each term in detail, so that people who are not familiar with it fully understand the proposal. In relation to the budget, I believe that the level of detail here was medium and still needs more detail for every section such as the budgeting plan, in promotional budget --> needs to be breakdown more (for example digital marketing by facebook ads for 1k dollars, and so on). In the end,  We know what each part of the project will cost, and regarding variable costs, they are very well calculated, broken down and explained so that we can understand exactly what would happen here. So I think the only thing I would suggest would be a little more detail in the phases.
f6_assessments.q2:
I found it interesting how concerned the team is with auditability. They are not only careful to pass on information that would help the rest of the community to monitor the progress of the project, but they drew up an aubitability plan in which they would monitor of Impressions - Impressions are defined as the number of times branded content has been displayed on screen.
Engagement - Engagement is defined as the number of times branded content has been liked/commented on Goodwall.
Challenge Entries - Challenge Entry is defined as an uploaded video or picture related to the program. And they are also giving us example of their report to show how they report about the result of each KPI. However, there is something odd that I found, namely regarding the timeframe of the KPI they will achieve, namely the unavailability of for example every few months it is achieved. So they have to determine for example the KPI of 1 million impressions must be achieved for each post within a month or I suggest SMART goals for instance, the goal to build the addon is "S"pecific, "M"easurable, "A"chievable, "R"easonable and "T"imebound 
 to make this project more auditable. In the end, overall the  roadmap with not so clear deliverables, milestones and timeframes are provided in the proposal and need details.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal fully addresses the challenge setting by providing content to youth across the world, but specifically in east asia. I really like the idea of starting dialogue amongst the younger generation because it allows the students to get involved in projects that they are passionate about. Beginning to teach students about cardano early will allow them to develop their passions for the ecosystem and eventually contribute to the ecosystem in their own different ways. The students can then also improve their own communities with blockchain use, which is another of the challenge setting’s goals. 

The objectives for the students that were listed in the proposal are almost similar to catalyst school but for a younger audience, which I think is really important. By engaging the students now, they will develop their skills, which will lead to big creations and developments in the future. Even if students from this program do not end up creating their own catalyst projects, I do think that the educational part of the project will encourage students to interact with cardano in other ways, such as voting, staking, or even becoming a CA/vCA. In the end, this proposal will help to grow cardano from the younger members of east asian society. (score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the information about the proposers, I have full confidence in the success of this project. The proposers all have many years of experience in project design, education, event implementation, and many other relevant fields to this proposal. I also appreciate that the proposers listed the tasks that each individual will undertake throughout implementation of this proposal – it really helps me understand who will be taking charge with what tasks, so I can have more confidence in the proposers. 
The list of  tasks to be completed provided by the proposers is very thorough. I think that all the items on the list can be achieved in the given timeframe. It is good that the project has been subdivided into three different categories: development, execution, and results. This way, the cardano community can see what exactly will be happening when. One minor question I do have for the proposers is whether the three sections in the timeline will be happening in sequential order or in tandem? This small detail is unclear to me after reading the proposal. 
With regards to the budget, I think that the proposers have done a great job of breaking down the funds and listing out where money will be going to. It is very clear to me what parts of the project will cost how much money. Although I do not have experience with running an educational company, I think the funds requested are reasonable given the scope of the project and the number of team members working on it. Overall, I think that this proposal is very feasible with the given information. (score given: 5)
f6_assessments.q2: Given the information provided, the proposal will be fully auditable. The proposers have listed out broad categories for ways to measure success, such as impressions, engagement, and challenge entries. In addition, the proposers included specific quantitative KPIs (1 million impressions, 30,000 engagements, 2,000 challenge entries) that the community can use to track the success of the proposal. They also included some specific ways in which the proposal will benefit people from east asian countries, such as the multilingual content from teams across the continent. Lastly, the proposers listed a sample document of a report that they will publish at the end of the project. If the file they publish is anything like the sample, I have full confidence in the auditability of the project because it is very thorough and easy to read. (score given: 5)

f6_assessments.q0:
Impact of this proposal to the community:
- use a big and known online platform (Goodwall) to share information around Cardano: will facilitate to reach out to many people and increase the chance to get them onboard
- Focus the produce information on Cardano and blcockchain to the youth (16-24 yrs): who are open minded and easy going, open to start new things, including all the work around the Cardanoo blockchain
- try to target the youth from the East Asia community: they can bbe attracted and get involved into the catalyst community
As an universal platform used by youth from various regions of the world, this proposal may be scalable by expanding it to youth from other parts oof the world.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Goodwall is a great tool to promote any new idea to the youth, especially if it related to education and work, which is the case for the Cardano blockchain explored in this proposal.
the proposers team if formed by peoplel with expertise in marketing, promotion, production but who are still new to the Catalyst ecosystem. Theh Catalyst is still a new approach to them.
Having access to the GoodWall platform is very impressive to facilitate success to an initiative like the current proposal, however the challenge in this situation would be, how to make a difference between information shared only to the East Asia Youth, who are part of the Goodwall community. This is focus for this proposal but istrategy to reach out to that group is not clear. This makes me doubt with the success of this project.
The project budget is grouped in sections with various items that would be necessary to specify the cost in detail.
f6_assessments.q2:
Information about the project is planned to be hosted to the GoodWall platform, so it may bbe accessible with the community for tracking and audit of the progress.
A serie of risks have been raised by proposers , including how to make the focus to the East Asia youth community in that big universe, which the Goodwall. By not being adressed, the proposal idea is great and may be successful on a big scale in the current configuration, but probably hard for a specific community, part of the big community.

f6_assessments.q0: The project creates educational videos about blockchain basics, blockchain applications, and social impact for youth from 16 to 24 years old. This is not a new idea, but it is necessary. Young people in their teens are often interested in blockchain technology and future careers. The youth outreach project will help the Cardano Blockchain to spread easily. And the project has a Goodwall platform with a fairly large number of users, so it can take advantage of that database to expand and attract users who are interested in blockchain, especially Cardano. Impact projects are relatively suitable for this Challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan is very specific and detailed. The implementation timetable is divided and calculated by weeks.
The detailed budget calculation for each item. If possible, you should attach a detailed excel sheet that will be easier to check. The budget makes up 15% of the Challenge's total budget.
Project development team member with many years of experience. Experience relevant to project development content. The member information, the experience can be checked by Linkedin.
f6_assessments.q2:
Can the proponent provide specific metrics for the project? The project will report the project results at the end. The report form is also attached, very easy to understand.
The success of the project is stated in detail through the number of videos, detailed KPIs. However, the contribution to the development of East Asia has not been clearly seen, contributing to Cardano through the success of the project.

solution: Educate youth on the basics of blockchain, its applications, and social impact possibilities, through learning programs on Goodwall
experience: Goodwall is a mobile-first platform with 2M+ members across 150+ countries, guiding youth aged 16-24 through the world of education and work. Goodwall has hosted a number of wide-scale programs and challenges on the platform, with a recent program reaching 4.2M+ youth in Ghana.
